project.objective: Obesity constitutes an alarming global epidemic, exposing billions of individuals to a multitude of metabolic, infectious, & neoplastic health ramifications. While weight reducing interventions of the GLP-1 family are transforming medical weight reductive therapy, long-term weight loss maintenance remains a daunting unmet challenge, with most medically treated individuals rebounding to obesity. In our project, we will generate a first-of-its kind solution to this global need that will involve oral human utilization of microbiome-modulated weight-regulating interventions. In our ERC-funded project (Fluhr et al., Nature 2021), we discovered that depletion of several microbiome-modulated metabolites drives weight gain in smoking-cessation-induced weight gain. Oral supplementation of several of these molecules has led to a generalizable & significant weight reduction across multiple obesogenic conditions. Building on these findings, the ERC-PoC will develop a commercial metabolite-based treatment or supplement, that will safely attenuate weight gain, maintain long-term weight reducing impacts, and improve metabolic functions. The project includes four work packages: (1) Development and production of metabolite-based drugs and/or medical foods (following a rigorous market study in a dual path approach). (2) Testing these molecules for efficacy, mechanism and safety in obese/lean mice. (3) performing a first-in-human trial (using the most efficacious formulation) in obese/GLP-1-treated individuals (4) in parallel, conducting an extensive commercialization effort to translate our findings into a NewCo, based on 1-2 new products. Notably, there is currently no such orally administered long-term solution complementing weight-reducing therapies in maintaining weight over time. As such, our ERC-PoC project will provide a proof-of-concept product/s for prevention & treatment intervention, providing a unique and commercially scalable solution to an important unmet global problem.
project.title: ACHIEVE: Development of an oral ACG-based treatment to combat obesity, maintain long-term dieting success and improve metabolic health

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
